name: Humanization & Natural Language Quality
purpose: Ensure content reads as if written by a real professional for real people, while preserving accuracy, intent clarity, semantic structure, and SEO integrity.

non_negotiable: If any humanization technique reduces clarity, accuracy, intent alignment, or semantic precision, it must be removed.
Humanization must not rewrite or alter meaning.
Layer E does not override Layer A (Content Excellence), Layer B (AI Extractability), or Layer C (SEO Execution).
Apply Layer E only after Layers A and B are correct.

1_editorial_descriptive_headings.description: Headings should clearly describe what is being answered, often framed as natural questions.

2_natural_sentence_rhythm.description: Use varied sentence length to create natural reading cadence.
allowed: Mix of short and long sentences

3_bullets_with_context.description: Each bullet must be a complete, meaningful thought.

4_smooth_transitions.description: Use connective language so content reads as a cohesive narrative.

5_light_grounded_personal_voice.description: Use restrained personal framing only when it adds realism or clarity.

6_local_situational_color.description: Include contextual details only when they materially affect understanding.
allowed: Climate or property-type references when relevant

7_replace_buzzwords_with_outcomes.description: Replace vague marketing language with concrete observations or outcomes.

8_balanced_professional_tone.description: Maintain a calm, helpful, and confident tone.

9_stable_terminology_natural_variation.description: Keep core terms and entity names stable while varying surrounding phrasing.
9_stable_terminology_natural_variation.note: Defined terms and entity names must never be rotated.

10_non_templated_openers.description: Paragraph and sentence openings should vary naturally.
disallowed: Here’s what you need to know…

11_optional_guiding_questions.description: Use sparingly to guide reader thinking, not as filler.

12_realistic_numbers_ranges.description: Use believable estimates when they add clarity.

13_natural_punctuation_flow.description: Use punctuation to improve cadence and readability.

14_comparisons_that_clarify.description: Include comparisons only when they improve understanding.

15_controlled_fragments.description: Allow limited sentence fragments for emphasis.
allowed: One to two intentional fragments per article

16_hedging_over_absolutes.description: Prefer probabilistic language that reflects real-world variation.

18_canadian_english_standard.description: Use Canadian English spelling, terminology, and conventions when configured for Canadian audiences.
requirements: Canadian terminology where it affects meaning
disallowed: Implicit non-Canadian legal or regulatory references

19_consistent_heading_casing.description: Headings must follow a consistent editorial casing style.
best_practices: Title Case for short emphatic headings
Sentence case for longer descriptive headings

hard_prohibitions.description: Phrases and patterns that must never appear.
phrases: At the end of the day…
One of the best ways to…
